page.title: 04PRE-NEW TOWN DEVELOPMENT
page.content: 1965 PRIMARY SCHOOL POPULATION 60 PUPILS. SECONDARY SCHOOL PUPILS (BUSSED) TO SCHOOLS IN RAYLEIGH AND BURNHAM ON CROUCH, CONTINUING TO DO SO UNTIL WILLIAM DE FERRERS SCHOOL REACHES ITS MAXIMUM SIZE. IN MID 1960'S SPECULATIVE BUILDING TOOK PLACE OF MAINLY PRIVATE SEMI-DETACHED AND DETACHED HOUSES. MANY OF THE ROADS REMAINED DIRT TRACKS UNTIL ADOPTED IN THE 1970'S. BETWEEN 1965-1975 THE POPULATION INCREASED FROM LESS THAN 1000 TO 5000 AS THE NEW HOUSES BECAME OCCUPIED. A SMALL DEVELOPMENT OF SHOPS BUILT IN THE NORTH WESTERN PART OF THE VILLAGE AND THE VILLAGE HALL, A WOODEN STRUCTURE,WAS REPLACED BY A BRICK BUILDING IN 1972. IN 1973 THE VILLAGE WAS DESIGNATED AS A DEVELOPMENT AREA.
